member.name: T:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer
member.summary: A service container backed by Sprint.NET

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new service container, and configures it from the Spring config.
member.remarks: In most cases you'll probably just want to use `ServiceContainer.Instance`

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.#ctor(Spring.Context.IApplicationContext)
member.summary: Instantiates a new service container using the provided application context.
member.param: You can think of this `container` as the underlying Spring backing. This is "the thing".

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all reasources currently being used by this container.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.GetService(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the service if any of the provided name.
member.param: The name of the service to obtain.
member.returns: Returns the service of the specified name.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.GetService(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the service if any of the provided name. Further asserts that the service is on an expected type.
member.param: The name of the service to obtain.
The type the service is expected to be.
member.returns: Returns the service of the specified name.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.GetService``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the service if any of the provided name and type.
member.typeparam: The type of the service being obtained.
member.param: The name of the service to obtain.
member.returns: Returns the service of the specified name.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.ContainsService(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the container has a service of a specified name.
member.param: The name of the service to check for.
member.returns: Returns true if the service exists; otherwise returns false.

member.name: P:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.Instance
member.summary: A singleton instance of the service container.
